p:
Aerial parts of Tanacetum parthenium were used to create a hydroethanolic extract that was tested against HSV-1 (strain KOS) in Vero and mouse fibroblast (L-929) cells by Benassi-Zanqueta et al.
162 The extract encouraged wound healing in L-929 cells, demonstrating a fivefold increase in wound healing at 48 hours and a 3-fold increase at 72 hours compared to control. In addition, the extract inhibited viral replication in Vero cells, demonstrating EC 50 and SI values of 3.1 Î¼g/ml and 18.1, respectively.
